entry.title: Take a chance on me
entry.summary:
Author: Panickymouse29

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 36,625Chapters: 21/?Kudos: 18

Summary: Aileen Allen was recruited into the Avatar Program at twenty-two after drawing RDA attention for her effectiveness in close-quarters security operations where escalation repeatedly failed. She wasn’t chosen for aggression, but for control—she ended threats quickly and quietly in environments where firearms were a liability. The RDA classified her as difficult: independent, resistant to rigid command, and openly critical of excessive force. Those traits would normally have ended her candidacy. Dr. Grace Augustine intervened, citing Aileen’s adaptability and restraint as exactly what the program lacked. On Pandora, Aileen immediately modified her uniform for mobility and heat, ignoring protocol in favour of survival. She demonstrated an unusual tendency to de-escalate Na’vi encounters rather than provoke them, earning Grace’s quiet approval—and RDA’s suspicion. By the time Jake Sully arrived, Aileen was already operating on the fringe of RDA control: respected by the scientists, tolerated by command, and trusted by Grace to act when others would make things worse.Pandora didn’t recruit Aileen Allen. Grace Augustine did.

entry.title: Flipping Coin
entry.summary:
Author: VillianEater

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,591Chapters: 1/7Kudos: 1

Summary: A Wayne’s path was written long before they could walk it. Born to power, bound to legacy. As the sole heir to a dynasty of wealth and philanthropy, Bryce Wayne, Gotham’s golden princess, was destined to inherit her mother’s grace, not her father’s empire, not his war. But all of that changed the night her parents died.From their ashes the Bat of Gotham rose. Not a myth. Not a man. But a young woman who refused to let the city her parents built, fall into ruin. She fought alone, until a farm boy from Kansas fell out of the sky and called himself Superman. Where she had only known shadows, he was sunlight. So bright, unshakable and endlessly hopeful.Bryce never understood his faith in humanity. Not when she had seen the worst of it. Not when so many good people were lost.But he was Superman and maybe, just for once, she wanted to believe in heroes too. Or: What if Batman was a woman and Superman met her when they were both still young enough to believe they could save the world?

entry.title: La Belle et La Rose
entry.summary:
Author: Matador

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,595Chapters: 7/15Kudos: 27

Summary: Riquewihr is a strange place, people say. So steep in magic, with a beast as it's Lord... Harley's never paid the rumours any heed. Not when there are far more pressing issues closer to home. That is, until she finds herself volunteering to take her father's place in the belly of the beast: his castle. Beyond haunted, it's everything like the rumours and nothing like them at all. But is there more to the castle and it's terrifying occupant? And what of that rose, locked in the tower, of whom the Beast is most possessive of? (A Beauty & the Beast retelling)

entry.title: Seeing Red and Blue
entry.summary:
Author: Mauve_Muse

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,218Chapters: 6/9Kudos: 70

Summary: Lex Luthor knew how to stop Superman from flying—he just had to fly him somewhere else first. He thought his bases were covered. Then the alien's words echoed back to him, revealing the bat-shaped hole in his otherwise genius plan. Batman was a problem. Batman was the one rumored to monitor Superman’s vitals, who had ships that could cross galaxies, who likely had contingencies for red-sun scenarios, and—more importantly—the one man who would never stop looking. If Superman vanished, Batman would be on his heels before Lex had even cleared the atmosphere. So Batman had to go too. OR Superbat is stranded on a red sun planet <3

entry.title: Power
entry.summary:
Author: ope-uh-oh (shortjacketlongskirt)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 137,645Chapters: 27/?Kudos: 272

Summary: “Oh, you do like to flirt, don’t you?” Lex accused almost playfully, if not for the sharklike emptiness in his eyes. Bruce sat back as the appetizer plates were taken away and replaced with the entrée: filet mignon in a mushroom gravy, served with truffles, asparagus, and black garlic potatoes. He couldn’t help but think Clark would have appreciated this. And he desperately wished he was here with him rather than Vicki. He flashed a playful grin at Lex. “Flirting is what makes the world go round, Lex. What is that quote attributed to Oscar Wilde? ‘Everything in the world is about sex except sex, which is about power’. It applies to everything. Make people think you want them, and you’ve got the whole world in your hands.” After years of living in the closet, trying to ignore the truth, Bruce is finally cornered and is forced to come out in a very public way. This leads to a series of challenges, blending his public and private life in way he can’t escape.

entry.title: And you can quote me on that
entry.summary:
Author: maruja35

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,265Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 58

Summary: In a deviation from expectations, Clark and Bruce meet for the first time not as Superman and Batman, and not as reporter and billionaire business owner, but as some version of themselves somewhere in the middle of all their respective identities.Clark nods, pushes his glasses back into place, smiles. It's sweet. It's comfortable. Bruce feels a sense of peace — there's no need to rush this. He steals one last kiss, then walks back to his car.He remembers to text Clark later, when he's back at the manor and before patrol, letting him know he made it home safe and wishing him a good night.He sees Clark again, unplanned, unexpected, Saturday night.OrAfter the Rift, Clark keeps moving. He's a bit lonely, a bit less trusted than he was before, a bit optimistic about a budding new friendship - relationship? He's determined not to mess things up, but he will. Things never work out just right. Meanwhile, Bruce throws caution to the wind and lets someone in for a change. He thinks it's fine, until he makes eye contact with him from across the room and feels the cool knife of betrayal slide between his ribs. It only gets more complicated from there.
